href.description: This is the target URI, it can be specified as a Relative Reference or fully-qualified URI. Relative Reference should be used along with the di parameter to make it unique.

rel.description: The relation of the target URI referenced by the link to the context URI encoded as a string

rt.description: Resource Type of the Resource encoded as a string array

if.description: The interface set supported by this resource encoded as a string array

allOf.description: The device ID which is a UUID formatted string

p.description: Specifies the framework policies on the Resource referenced by the target URI

bm.description: Specifies the framework policies on the Resource referenced by the target URI for e.g. observable and discoverable; which is an intteger encoded bitmap

title.description: A title for the link relation. Can be used by the UI to provide a context. Encoded as a string.

anchor.description: This is used to override the context URI e.g. override the URI of the containing collection. Encoded as a URI formatted string.

oneOf.description: An ordinal number that is not repeated - must be unique in the collection context. Represented as an integer.
A unique string formatted as a URI

ins.description: The instance identifier for this web link in an array of web links - used in collections

type.description: A hint at the representation of the resource referenced by the target URI. This represents the media types that are used for both accepting and emitting. Encoded as a string

eps.description: the Endpoint information of the target Resource; encoded as an array of objects

ep.description: String formatted as a URI with Transport Protocol Suites + Endpoint Locator as specified in 10.2.1

pri.description: The priority among multiple Endpoints as specified in 10.2.3; encoded as an integer
